definition: to curl up/to lie with knees drawn up/to huddle up
to curl up (like a scroll)/to huddle/Melania libertina/wriggle (as a worm)
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt

sentences.english: And shall we crouch above these graves.
sentences.chinese: 難道我們理應蜷伏在他們的墓穴上。

sentences.english: The dog curled up on the floor and went to sleep .
sentences.chinese: 這條狗蜷伏在地板上，睡着了。

sentences.english: I look down and see my own shadow crouching on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 我低着頭，看見我的影子正好像在地面上蜷伏着。

sentences.english: We nested in our little room and listened to the sounds outside.
sentences.chinese: 我們蜷伏在我們小小的房間裏，聽着外面喧雜的聲音。

sentences.english: There was an enormous cat crouching on the counter.
sentences.chinese: 櫃檯上蜷伏着一隻碩大的貓。

sentences.english: He likes to sleep with his knees drawn up.
A female lion squatted in the shrub, waiting for her games.
sentences.chinese: 一隻母獅蜷伏在灌木叢中，靜候着她的獵物。

sentences.english: The children snuggled down on the hay.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們舒適地蜷伏在乾草上。

sentences.english: A weeping woman cowered on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 一個哭泣的婦女蜷伏在地上發抖。

sentences.english: He discovered the house in the Rue Plumet, and hid himself from sight there.
sentences.chinese: 他發現卜呂梅街的那所屋子，便蜷伏在那裏。

sentences.english: The dog cowered (down) under the table.
sentences.chinese: 那隻狗嚇得蜷伏在桌子底下。

sentences.english: You're crouched behind a burned shell of an old minivan.
sentences.chinese: 你蜷伏在一輛被燒燬的舊車後面。

sentences.english: Stray cat crouched in the cold wind rain lane angle, smell musty.
sentences.chinese: 流浪貓蜷伏在陰冷的巷角，嗅着風雨中的黴味。

definition: to curl up (like a scroll)/to huddle/Melania libertina/wriggle (as a worm)
to curl up/to lie curled up
to sleep soundly/to fall into a deep sleep
to doze/to take a nap/nodding off to sleep
to curl up shivering (from cold)/timid and trembling (in fear)/to shrink/to cower
